Class ModifyProductFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProductFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
FXML Controller Class for the Modify Product Form. The main purpose of these methods is to read data entered by the user and use it to modify a product. This is very similar to the Add Product Form.

  • Method Details

    • onActionAddAssociatedPart

      void onActionAddAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method adds an associated part. It checks to make sure that a part is selected. If not, it creates a dialog.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking on the Add Associated Part button.

    • onActionCancelModifyProduct

      void onActionCancelModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method cancels the modification of the product. It returns the user to the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking on the cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionRemoveAssociatedPart

      void onActionRemoveAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method removes a part from the list the product's of associated parts. It checks to make sure that the user has selected a part to remove, and it shows a dialog boss to confirm if the user is sure.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking on the remove associated part button.

    • onActionSaveModifyProduct

      void onActionSaveModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method saves the modified product over its original spot in the Inventory. It checks to ensure that the data the user has entered is valid, and then it saves the product, overwriting the original product, and returns the user to the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking on the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionAllPartsSearchKeyPressed

      void onActionAllPartsSearchKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      This method searches the list of parts. It activates when the user presses the enter key while the search field is highlighted. It iterates through the list of parts to see if it can find the sought after part, and creates a dialog box if it cannot. If it can, it highlights the part or narrows the list, depending on if the search was for an ID or a Name. The code here is identical to the method in the Add Product form.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of pressing a key while the search field is selected.

    • recieveProduct

      public void recieveProduct(Product selectedProduct, int position)
      RUNTIME ERROR This method receives the product to be modified and displays its data in the text fields. It also stores the index of the original product in the Inventory's product list so that that position can be written to later. One runtime error I ran into was resolved while I was writing this method. Initially I had the Modify Product form save its new product into the slot of its ID in the Inventory's product list. However, this caused a crash when the ID of the products exceeded the number of items in the list due to products being deleted. This was solved, by tracking the index of the original product in receiveProduct and using it here to ensure we are writing the product to the same place we read it from.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - The product to be modified
      position - The index of the product to be modified in the Inventory's product list

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class for the modify product form. It sets up the tableviews, ensuring that the columns are prepared for the data they will be receiving.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL used to initialize
      rb - The ResourceBundle used to initialize.
